name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: Law's Heart-Switching Deception Revealed
keyMoments.description: Law reveals through flashback how he deceived Caesar from the beginning of their partnership by secretly returning Monet's heart instead of his own, and later giving Caesar Monet's heart disguised as Smoker's.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Law's tactical brilliance and shows he was planning to betray Caesar from the start, never truly allied with him. This revelation saves Smoker's life and prevents the island's explosion.
keyMoments.quote: I kindly gave back the heart of the secretary, Monet.

keyMoments.title: Law Explains His Planning to Smoker
keyMoments.description: Law answers Smoker's question about how he possessed his heart the entire time, explaining the depth of his manipulations throughout the Punk Hazard arc.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial context for understanding Law's true motivations and plans, showing his alliance with the Straw Hats was genuine while his partnership with Caesar was always a ruse.

reveals.information: Law deceived Caesar from the beginning by switching hearts, never trusting him

keyMoments.title: Caesar Stabs Monet's Heart Thinking It's Smoker's
keyMoments.description: Caesar attempts to kill Smoker by stabbing what he believes is Smoker's heart, but unknowingly stabs Monet's heart instead due to Law's deception.
keyMoments.significance: Caesar's arrogance and cruelty lead to his downfall as he discovers too late that Law outsmarted him. His action accidentally saves everyone on Punk Hazard from the island's explosion.

reveals.information: Caesar was completely fooled by Law's heart-switching deception

keyMoments.title: Monet Collapses from Heart Stabbing
keyMoments.description: Monet collapses in Building C with blood flowing from her mouth after Caesar stabs her heart, her hand falling away from the self-destruct button. Her apparent death prevents the island's explosion.
keyMoments.significance: Monet's unwavering loyalty to Doflamingo leads to her apparent death at the hands of Caesar's betrayal. Her fate remains debated in the One Piece community, with some believing she survived.

reveals.information: Monet's heart was stabbed by Caesar, causing her apparent death

keyMoments.title: Smoker Questions Law About His Heart
keyMoments.description: Smoker asks Law how he managed to possess his heart the entire time when Caesar supposedly had it, learning about Law's deception.
keyMoments.significance: Smoker realizes how close he came to death and understands the depth of Law's planning, showing grudging respect for Law's tactics.

name.japanese: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

keyMoments.title: Doflamingo Decides to Personally Go to Punk Hazard
keyMoments.description: After learning the island wasn't destroyed and Caesar was captured, Doflamingo makes the decision to personally handle the situation, putting on his feather coat and preparing to leave Dressrosa.
keyMoments.significance: Marks a major escalation showing how important Caesar and SAD production are to Doflamingo's operations. His personal involvement indicates the threat level posed by the Straw Hat-Law alliance.

keyMoments.title: Doflamingo Uses Sora no Michi to Fly Toward Punk Hazard
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo leaps from his palace and uses his Sora no Michi (Sky Path) technique to run through the sky over the ocean, attaching his strings to clouds to travel from Dressrosa toward Punk Hazard.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Sora no Michi technique, revealing a new application of his Ito Ito no Mi powers and his ability to travel great distances quickly.

abilities.description: Doflamingo attaches his strings to clouds in the sky, allowing him to move through the air and travel great distances by running on the strings.

reveals.information: Doflamingo can fly by attaching strings to clouds using Sora no Michi technique

keyMoments.title: Baby 5 Debuts Revolver Girl Technique
keyMoments.description: Baby 5 demonstrates her Buki-morphose: Revolver Girl technique, transforming her body into a giant gun barrel and firing rapidly at Franky Shogun.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Baby 5's Revolver Girl transformation, showcasing the versatility of the Buki Buki no Mi and establishing her combat capabilities as a member of the Donquixote Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Baby 5's Revolver Girl Attack Fails Against Franky Shogun
keyMoments.description: Baby 5's intense barrage in Revolver Girl form fails to defeat Franky Shogun, who withstands the attack and counterattacks.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates both Baby 5's offensive capabilities and Franky Shogun's durability in combat.

abilities.description: Baby 5 transforms her body into a giant gun barrel and fires rapidly using her Buki Buki no Mi powers.

keyMoments.title: Buffalo Contacts Doflamingo About Failed Explosion
keyMoments.description: Buffalo uses a Den Den Mushi to contact Doflamingo at Dressrosa, informing him that Punk Hazard was not destroyed and Caesar was captured.
keyMoments.significance: This communication escalates the conflict to the next level, bringing Doflamingo directly into the action and setting up his personal involvement.

keyMoments.title: Franky Shogun Counterattacks Baby 5
keyMoments.description: After Baby 5's Revolver Girl attack, Franky Shogun emerges largely unharmed and counterattacks by punching Baby 5 from behind.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's post-timeskip power and the effectiveness of his Franky Shogun battle form against capable Devil Fruit users.
